Emacs Dropbox Beorg

I’m an emacs and iOS user. I’ve basically live in emacs and I love it. Having my life in plain text just give me so much clarity.

I use Beorg on iOS to maintain my agenda and capture tasks for org-mode on the go but it turns out, the syncing with Dropbox and emacs (on the desktop) doesn’t entirely work “out of the box” unless you have a couple of things in your emacs config.

Everything works fine with syncing files up to Dropbox when things change but to get emacs on the desktop to update automagically, you’ll need the following settings in your emacs config turned on.

Auto save mode is used to save files in the background when you don’t save them explicitly. This is critical when you change an org file on your desktop that you want to sync to Beorg.

(auto-save-mode t)

Auto revert mode is used when you change an org file in Beorg that you want emacs on the desktop to automagically reload in the background. 

(auto-revert-mode t)

With both of these settings turned on, Beorg on iOS and Dropbox it makes this setup pretty magical. Everything is always up to date and in sync. Just watch your buffers update in real time :)
